result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory J Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory J Walker in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Gregory J Walker in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentences defendant to serve 68 days in the House of Correction with credit for 68 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 1/23/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Filed, pretrial incarceration credit, notice of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Gregory J Walker in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Gregory J Walker in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to count 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 1 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.  Trial date is vacated.  Case set for sentencing on 1-21-2016; defendant is remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Gregory J Walker in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Gregory J Walker in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defense informs the court that the defendant is applying for DRUG TREATMENT COURT with his felony Retail Theft and misdemeanor Retail Theft pending cases.    Case set for final pretrial on 1-5-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 1-20-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with NL dob 12/21/86

Defendant Gregory J Walker in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Gregory J Walker in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Notice returned undeliverable.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file.  ($100.00) ad
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.  Cash bail on deposit ordered forfeited.

Attorney James D. Rael in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Cash bail on deposit ordered forfeited.

15RM035433  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/28/2015

Attorney Alexis Stewart appeared via telephonics.  Defendant Gregory J Walker NOT in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court heard and granted the Motion of Defense Counsel to Withdraw.  Attorney Stewart is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 48 on 8-5-2015 at 8:15 am.    Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with N.L. DOB 12/21/86.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gregory J Walker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Gregory J Walker in custody.  Student Intern Sarah Zwach appears under the supervision of David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
